definition: spilt water is difficult to retrieve (idiom)/it's no use crying over spilt milk/what's done is done and can't be reversed/the damage is done/once divorced, there's no reuniting
to cover/to overflow/to overturn/to capsize
variant of 復|复[fu4]/to reply to a letter
surname Shui
water/river/liquid/beverage/additional charges or income/(of clothes) classifier for number of washes
difficult (to...)/problem/difficulty/difficult/not good
disaster/distress/to scold
to receive/to accept/to collect/to put away/to restrain/to stop/in care of (used on address line after name)

sentences.english: Last year's dispute is water under the bridge now.
sentences.chinese: 去年的爭論已經是覆水難收了。

sentences.english: You all know the expression, ? "Don't cry over spilt milk." Right?
sentences.chinese: 你們都知道有句話叫做，“覆水難收“，對嗎？

definition: to bring trouble on oneself (idiom)
lit. wind past your ear/fig. sth you don't pay much attention to/in one ear and out the other
lit. small belly, chicken's gut (idiom); narrow-minded/petty
to patch up one's lie (when inconsistencies appear)/to cover (for sb who has lied)
lit. chickens flying and dogs jumping (idiom)/fig. in chaos/in disarray
reckless/extremely daring
to do one's best/to shape up/to behave/to fend for oneself/you're on your own
to know the score (idiom)/to be well aware of the situation
to get straight to the point (idiom)
chicken-hearted (idiom)/gutless
to submit to the will of heaven/to resign oneself to fate/to trust to luck
white lie
trivial matter/a piece of cake
foolish talk/nonsense
lit. not even the chickens and dogs are left undisturbed (idiom)/fig. great commotion/pandemonium
traitor to one's love/heartless rat
